section.title: Introduction
section.para: &app; is a General purpose Wallpaper Changer for the GNOME desktop which can change the desktop background image after an adjustable time. The aim of &app; is to make it easier for you to keep your desktop "fresh" and new!

sect2.title: To Start &app;
sect2.para: You can start &app; in the following ways:

sect2.title: When You Start &app;
sect2.para: When you start &app;, the following window is displayed.

textobject.phrase: Shows &app; main window with sidebar opened on playlist. Contains menubar, display area, sidebar, elapsed time slider, seek control buttons, volume slider and statusbar.

sect2.para: The &app; window contains the following elements:

listitem.para: Use this menu to Add files like a &app; album, single images or a folder with it's subfolers, Start/Pause/Stop Process, Move to the next image, or Close the window.
Use this menu to set your Preferences or to remove saved history.
View information about &app; through the About menuitem. Open this document with the Contents menuitem or by pressing F1.
The item's list is the images that &app; will use to change the Desktop Background. Use the buttons right of the Item's list to add/remove items or change their position on the list.
When you select an image on the Item's List a preview will be available.
Theese two spinboxes enables you timing selection.
Theese two checkboxes enable you to change Desktop Background randomly or in a random time .
The seek control buttons enable you to move to the next image and to Start/Pause/Stop the current process.
Take Screenshot of the entire screen.

section.title: Usage
section.para: 1. Add your wallpapers to the Item's List by simply dragging and dropping them to the List or by clicking on the Add button to add images ( Ctrl + I ), or by clicking on the Add Folder Button to add images that are on a folder with it's subfolders ( Ctrl + F ), or by adding a Wallch album by dragging and dropping it at the List or from File Add Add a Wallch album . ( Ctrl + O ).
2. Set the interval to change the wallpaper via the spinboxes.
3. Press “Start” to start the process. That’s it.

note.para: One thing that you have to take note is that once you “Start” the program, you won’t be able to change the configuration (add/remove wallpapers, change interval etc) anymore. You will have to “Stop” the application to make changes to the configuration.
You can also change Desktop Wallpaper choosing images randomly or in a random time if the repsectively checkboxes are checked.

Right click on an item on the List to Set It as a Desktop Background ( Alternative: Double Click it or press Return ), Remove non-existing items that are on the list but not on your hard drive, permanetly delete image from hard drive, or view the image's properties.

section.para: When &app; is minimized to the tray, right-clicking the icon in the tray will reveal a menu in which you'll have a show action which will restore &app;, all seeking buttons and some options like showing the preferences dialog, the about dialog and closing &app;.

note.para: If the wallpaper changing module is running just click on the tray icon and it will proceed to the next image. If the wallpaper changing module is not running it will just restore the app. Also middle-click to close &app; instantly.

section.title: Preferences
section.para:
To modify the preferences of &app;, choose
Edit Preferences .

listitem.para: Change Desktop Wallpaper (Once): On Pc Start-up, &app; will change for once the current Desktop Wallpaper.
Start changing Desktop Wallpapers: On Pc Start-up, &app; will start the wallpaper changing module.
Auto-enable Live Earth Wallpaper: On Pc Start-up, Live Earth Wallpaper will be automatically activated.
Select it if you want &app; to be minimized to tray.

You can tell &app; how to display your wallpaper by selecting the 'Style' to display. Tile will tile the wallpaper to fill up the screen, this is useful for small wallpapers that would otherwise look distorted when zoomed in. Zoom fills up the screen like a magnifying glass. Center will center the wallpaper to the center of your screen. Scale will strech out the wallpaper to fill your screen, but will not change the aspect ratio, so that the wallpaper will fill up your screen the best it can, without modifying the picture itself. And finally, you can use stretch and span for multimonitor screens.
&app; Wallch allows you to create a photo album with your wallpapers, which you can later load through the program.
&app; provides also a notification sound and bubble when a wallpaper changed which you can deactivate if you want. You can also select your custom sound.

&app; keeps a history of the time and the options of the changed wallpaper. You can access the history file at the .config/WallpaperChanger/History folder. The default option is not to keep history but you can change it to keep Simple history ( month and day ) or Advanced History ( month,day and time ) or Very analytical history ( month,day and time and secs ). You can also keep history on a directory of your preference if you want.
You can change the language to Greek or to English.
The most interesting thing about &app; is the ability to set Live Earth images as the desktop wallpaper. Just press the “Activate Live Earth Wallpaper” button.

note.para: Live Earth Wallpaper module can’t work concurrently with the main wallpaper changing module. If you have “Started” the wallpaper changing module, you won’t be able to activate the Live Earth Wallpaper and the opposite. In addition, the changing interval is set to 1/2 hours.
